title: L'Italienne

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Gilbert W. Chapman
publication_history:
La Renaissance 20:10–12 (October¬December 1937), p. 9 (ill.), as L’Italienne, n.d.

Bignou Gallery, Paintings and Gouaches by Georges Rouault, exh. cat. (New York: Bignou Gallery, 1940), n.p., cat. 22, as L’Italienne,, n.d..

Dalzell Hatfield Galleries, Rouault, exh. cat. (Los Angeles: Dalzell Hatfield Galleries, 1940), n.p., cat. 11, as L’Italienne, n.d.

Lionello Venturi, Georges Rouault (New York: E. Weyhe, 1940), p. 75, pl. 100, no. 123, as L’Italienne, c. 1937.

Lionello Venturi, Georges Rouault (Paris: Albert Skira, 1948), p. 115, pl. 114, fig. 139, as L’Italienne, c. 1937.

Florent Fels, L’Art vivant de 1900 a nos jours (Geneva: Pierre Callier, 1950), p. 212 (ill.), as L’Italienne, n.d.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in the Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: The Art Institute, 1961), p. 405, as L'Italienne, late 1930s.

Pierre Courthion and Isabelle Rouault, Georges Rouault (New York: Harry N. Abrams, Inc., 1962), pp. 440 (ill.), pp. 440 and 465, no. 379, as L’Italienne, 1937 (Italian Woman).

Sandra Grung, Supplement to Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1971), p. 100, as L’Italienne, 1937.

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth Century European Paintings (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 68, no. 3F11, as L’Italienne, 1937.

Bernard Dorival and Isabelle Rouault, Rouault: L’oeuvre peint 2 (Monaco: Éditions André Sauret, 1988), p. 150, no. 1863(ill.), as L’Italienne I, 1937.
exhibition_history:
New York, Bignou Gallery, Paintings and Gouaches by Georges Rouault, May 1940, n.p., cat. 22, as L’Italienne, n.d.

Los Angeles, Dalzell Hatfield Galleries, Rouault, August 15–September 15, 1940, n.p., cat. 11, as L’Italienne, n.d.

New York, Curt Valentin Gallery, September 1951.
provenance_text: Ambroise Vollard (1867–1939), Paris, 1937 [La Renaissance 1937]. Bignou Galleries, New York, by May 1940 [New York 1940]. Mrs. Gilbert W. Chapman (née Elizabeth Fuller, later Mrs. Charles Goodspeed; 1893–1980), Chicago by 1951; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1951.
